articles.summary:
BEIJING (Reuters) - Alibaba Group Holding Ltd's affiliate Ant Financial will
launch its planned online bank called MYbank in June, a group executive said
on Thursday, as China's internet companies increasingly encroach upon the turf
of traditional banks.
articles.title: Alibaba finance arm Ant Financial to launch online bank in June (reuters)

articles.summary:
KINGSTON, Jamaica (Reuters) - Double Olympic sprint silver medalist Yohan
Blake is targeting a podium finish at this year's world championships in
Beijing after recovering from hamstring surgery, though his management team
still have no definite date for his return to competition.
articles.title: Blake targets double at Beijing World Championships (reuters)

articles.author: THR staff
articles.summary: The anchor made the announcement Wednesday.
articles.title: Bob Schieffer Retiring From CBS News (Hollywood Reporter)

articles.summary:
(Reuters) - Bob Schieffer, the host of CBS's "Face the Nation" program, said
on Wednesday he will retire this summer after more than 50 years in
journalism.
articles.title: Bob Schieffer, host of CBS's 'Face the Nation,' to retire (reuters)

articles.summary:
THE British father and Filipina mother of a teenager have been arrested after
she plunged to her death from an upmarket Hong Kong apartment block.
articles.title: Dad arrested after girl falls to death (Cnet)

articles.author: Elizabeth Hayes
articles.summary:
The recent departure announcements among PeaceHealth’s top brass were both
unrelated and not forced, said Sister Andrea Nenzel, chair of the PeaceHealth
Governing Board. “To the best of my knowledge, they are all voluntary,” Nenzel
said. “They’re people who are saying they’re recognizing things are changing
around them and they want more time with their family and perhaps even a
different career. The board did not make that decision, and there has not been
a discussion at all as far…
articles.title: Exclusive: PeaceHealth's board chair addresses exodus of top executives (Biz Journal)

articles.author: Michael DeMasi
articles.summary:
Lionheart Pub -- an Albany, New York tavern filled with lively conversation,
craft beers on tap and nightly English dart leagues -- sold for $3.5 million.
The price was revealed exclusively to Albany Business Review by the seller,
Jerry Aumand, who opened the popular pub 22 years ago, and the buyer, Mike
Keller, who has been in the restaurant business two decades. Keller, 39,
bought Lionheart Pub and the building where it's located at 448 Madison Ave.
near Center Square, a neighborhood filled with…
articles.title: Exclusive: Popular Albany tavern sells for stunning price (Biz Journal)

articles.title: Gremlins Remake (Celebrities)

articles.summary:
KINGSTON, Jamaica (Reuters) - President Barack Obama arrived in Jamaica on
Wednesday to attend a Caribbean summit seeking to reassert U.S. leadership in
the region at time when oil-producing Venezuela's economic clout may be
receding.
articles.title: In Jamaica, Obama seeks to reassert U.S. leadership in Caribbean (reuters)

articles.summary:
The long-time Clint Eastwood collaborator Geoffrey Lewis, who was also an
actor, has died aged 79.
articles.title: Juliette Lewis' father and actor dies (The Sydney Morning Herald )

articles.author: Eric Jay Toll
articles.summary:
Banner Health's headquarters move to midtown Phoenix is turning a lot of heads
in the local commercial real estate market. “There’s a migration to midtown
occurring,” said Scott Baumgarten, vice president of office services for DTZ.
“The vacancy rate in the midtown submarket has dropped to around 27 percent in
the first quarter. Midtown ranked fourth in the metro in office absorption
with 198,000 square feet last year. The Banner deal at 2901 N. Central Ave.
and Arizona Department of Child…
articles.title: Midtown Phoenix towers are bargain office hotspots (Biz Journal)

articles.summary:
WASHINGTON (AP) -- President Barack Obama is calling for an end to psychiatric
therapy treatments aimed at changing the sexual orientation or gender identity
of gay, lesbian and transgender youth....
articles.title: Obama calls for end to gay 'conversion' therapy for youth (The Arizona Republic)

People who support police reform say watchdog smartphone apps are evidence of
the power of tech weapons in the fight.
articles.title: Phone Cameras and Apps Help Speed Calls for Police Reform (NY Times)

articles.author: Chris Palmer
articles.summary:
DOYLESTOWN — Claire Risoldi, a prominent fundraiser for Bucks County
Republicans accused of conspiring with her family to steal $20 million from an
insurer, Wednesday was ordered to face trial on more than a dozen charges,
including being part of a corrupt organization, fraud, and witness...
articles.title: Risoldis ordered to face trial in Bucks County insurance fraud case (morningcall)

articles.summary:
SEOUL (Reuters) - South Korea's Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Thursday it
expects record shipments for the latest version of its flagship Galaxy
smartphones.
articles.title: Samsung Electronics says expects Galaxy S6 models to set new shipments record (reuters)

articles.summary:
(Reuters) - In an abrupt changing of the guard, Zynga has announced that Chief
Executive Don Mattrick will step down and founder Mark Pincus will return to
lead the company as it struggles to adapt to the changing tastes of gamers.
articles.title: Zynga CEO resigns, founder Mark Pincus steps back in (reuters)
